OK were do i start with this movie.is it worth me writing a review,well stay tuned and you will find out.lets just say this is gonna be a very lazy review.after watching this movie,i can say that I've broke my record for the worst movie ever made and I've watched thousands of movies.it starts of were 28 days later did,a deserted London.it doesn't take a genius to guess how many survivors are left as says the movie.one as got a drinking problem,another one thinks hes rambo etc.they have a strall round London trying to figure out whats gone on,which takes nearly all the movie and then a awful little twist at the end.this movie is a disgrace,how can they make tripe like this these days is beyond me.there's know story,the acting is truly addismall.the actors were so miscast,and at at times just embarrassing.if there was one movie that didn't need to be made than this is it.danny dyer will do any movie thats thrown at him as long as hes getting a paycheck at the end of it,its a joke.i would rather watch home made bread rise in the oven than watch this movie again. its the worst movie on the planet by a long way i cant stress enough.please people stay away from this tripe,its not even worth bird feed.do some bird watching,anything just to stay away from this TERRIBLE movie

This movie keeps you guessing as to what is really going on right til the end. Most of the time I can tell you the ending of a movie after 5 minutes, this one ... not a snowballs chance in hell. I'm still not 100% clear on the very last seen but it is interesting and cause for thought. If you think Shakspear is a rapper then this movie is not for you. If you think the Transporter series of movies are works of art then this movie is not for you. If you think the word religion is another way of saying redneck, then this movie is not for you. If you enjoy movies that come up with creative ways to tell a story then you'll like The Last Seven.
